Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: BubbleTone Messenger: Updated Version Released  The Bubbletone team is glad to announce that an updated version of the messenger was released on April 25 for Android and April 30 for iOS. The team fixed a number of nasty software bugs and implemented a number of noticeable improvements to make it possible for the app to run smoothly.  As the new version of the app is stable, its release has made future integration of the messenger with mobile operators that will be using the blockchain-based marketplace possible.  The team has fixed serious problems related to the Android version of the app. As for the iOS version, only the most urgent issues have been resolved. Our development team continues to search for bugs and fix them. We kindly ask those members of the community who are interested in the project development to download the application and test it thoroughly.  If you detect any bugs, please send information describing the found bugs and the phone model on which the application was installed and tested to our Telegram channel administrators. The administrators will compile a list of detected bugs and hand the document over to the development team. You can also express your opinion on the design and functionality of the messenger. It is thanks to your help that we will be able to greatly improve the application.  It is also worth mentioning that the web version of the app is scheduled for its release in Autumn 2019. In the web version of the messenger will be implemented most of the functions that are present in the mobile version, including calls to landline and mobile network phones.  The messenger is available on the App Store and Google Play:  https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/bubbletone/id1298142945?mt=8  https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.countrycom.bubbletone   About BubbleTone  Customized for the needs of mobile operators, the BubbleTone messenger provides operators with additional revenue streams on voice calls and SMS messages from the app and other telecom services. When it comes to end users, the app enables them to make calls to both landline and mobile network phones, as well as send SMS messages to mobile network phones, all straight from the app, regardless of the user's location, saving them money.  https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/bubbletone-messenger-updated-version-released-f1f4670b1d39

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone Showcased its Technological Solution at MVNOs World Congress 2019  Bubbletone participated in MVNOs World Congress 2019, the largest dedicated MVNO event, that took place in Amsterdam on May 21-24. The team members presented Bubbletone's decentralized platform for the telecom industry and its use cases to key players in the global MVNO market.  As the only meeting place for the global MVNOs community with dedicated tracks in IoT, eSIM, Blockchain, Fintech and Wholesale, the event brought together over 800 senior MVNOs professionals, 240 MVNOs and 130 speakers from around the globe. Among the participants were the following telecom industry’s players: China Mobile Limited, Deutsche Telekom, Vodafone, Mobilcom-Debitel, Singtel Optus, Telecom Italia, O2/Telefonica, Lycamobile, FreedomPop, Fenercell (MVNO of Fenerbahce SK), RedPocket Mobile, Acqua Telecom, Tinkoff Mobile, and many others.  Over the four days, the congress ignited innovation and accelerated growth in the MVNO space through several sessions focused on ideas brainstorming, co-operation, problem-solving and networking.  At the company’s booth (#33), Bubbletone’s CEO Yuri Morozov and Project Director Alexander Yakovenko introduced to the attendees the Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom platform and two use cases that are currently being implemented — Global Coverage with Local Rates for Subscribers and TeleChain Broker. They explained in detail how the use cases work and what benefits they could bring to MVNOs worldwide.  In addition, as one of the speakers, Alexander Yakovenko gave a presentation on the blockchain-based platform and its opportunities for mobile operators and answered the questions from the audience.  https://tmt.knect365.com/mvnos-world-congress/speakers/alexander-yakovenko#  https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/bubbletone-showcased-its-technological-solution-at-mvnos-world-congress-2019-942911a9cb1f

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Current Status on Platform Development: Q1 2019  During the first quarter of 2019, our development team has delivered a low-level API and two high-level specifications.   Low-level API   A low-level API is necessary for integration of mobile operators into the blockchain platform. As a basis upon which the entire system operates, the low-level API is a generic API for integration that allows for support of a wide range of business scenarios to work with a blockchain node.   The API sets out the procedure for interaction between software components to provide common functionality, but at the same time, the API allows us to abstract functionality away from specifics of implementation. The API documents how software components interact with each other. Software components that implement this low-level API have been built and are already functioning as expected.   The low-level API developed by our team is available at the following link: https://wiki.blockchaintele.com/index.php/Low_Level_API_JSON   High-level specifications   A high-level specification is technical documentation that describes in detail a specific business scenario for interaction between participants via the blockchain. For each use case that will be implemented on our platform, it is necessary to develop an appropriate high-level specification.   Having pursued a large number of negotiations with telecom operators, we have learned what services are now in highest demand. As a result, two high-level specifications have been developed — one for TeleChain Broker, a joint solution with Nexign, and the other for Global coverage with local rates for subscribers.   TeleChain Broker   Many telecom operators hold conservative views and are not ready to immediately implement disruptive solutions and change the established mechanism for providing services. The solution allows operators to easily connect to the blockchain platform — the traditional roaming infrastructure is preserved, and at the same time, they receive access to a new revenue stream. We called such an easy way to connect to our Bubbletone blockchain platform TeleChain Broker.   Within the TeleChain Broker marketplace, operators can create wholesale offers that consist of, for example, seasonal packages, and are valid within a specified period. In addition, deals are closed immediately, and prices can be changed at any time. Thus, TeleChain Broker allows operators to immediately bring products that are demanded by subscribers to the market, i.e. provide a short time to market, and receive additional revenue.   We are going to publish a blog post dedicated to this solution.   Global coverage with local rates for subscribers   The decentralized platform allows mobile network operators, even those who do not have roaming agreements, to interact securely and directly, without any complex integrations or intermediaries. The operators use multi-account SIM cards and distribute them among their subscribers. These cards allow subscribers to upload local mobile profiles “over-the-air”, i.e. via encrypted special binary SMS messages or the data channel using an SMPD platform (eSIM standard). Thus, while travelling, subscribers can purchase service packages at the rates of local operators and use their existing SIM card all over the globe.   To implement this use case, we are working on integrating the blockchain platform into billing systems of several telecom operators.   Our legal experts have also almost completed development of a public offer. Operators need to sign this document to be connected to the platform. The public offer outlines conditions for connecting operators to the platform.   In addition, we are working on the implementation of the subscriber identification process. Before an operator starts servicing a subscriber of another operator, they need to be able to confirm the identity of this subscriber.   Read the full story here: https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/current-status-on-platform-development-q1-2019-5183c31b9cba

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: New technologies, New Business Models, New Standards: Why Clementvale Baltic OÜ Joined ITU by ITU News  Clementvale Baltic OÜ has recently become an Associate member of the ITU Telecommunication Standardization Sector (ITU-T) to help shape the development of international standards for innovative technologies in the telecom industry. ITU News recently caught up with Clementvale Project Director Alexander Yakovenko to discuss how the company is addressing shifting market trends and how they aim to participate in ITU standards.   What are some of the most important trends for mobile communications in 2019-2020?  The telecom industry has changed significantly over the last few years. Currently, it is undergoing a digital transformation at an increasingly rapid pace. In my opinion, there is no doubt that 2019 and 2020 are to be years of drastic change. The power of the Internet of Things (IoT) and emerging technologies like 5G and eSIM will be leveraged, with Blockchain being no exception. Digital service providers will ensure implementation of these promising disruptive technological advancements to get access to new sales channels and lead in the market.   What new business models do you see emerging and how will Clementvale Baltic OÜ be part of them?  Currently, Clementvale Baltic OÜ is focused on the development of two innovative business models that leverage innovation solutions, including blockchain, and partnerships with other telecom players. Our business models provide telecom operators with the opportunity to receive additional revenue streams. These new business models will provide different levels of ease in terms of compliance with the established mechanism for providing services for telecom operators — one will be simpler, and the other more complex.   The easier-to-use model is a marketplace where wholesale deals to purchase and sell telecom service packages are made. The traditional roaming infrastructure is preserved and operators can create wholesale offers that consist of, for example, seasonal packages, and are valid within a specified period. This approach is unique since it opens up the opportunity to purchase service packages in bulk within existing roaming agreements. In addition, deals are closed immediately, and prices can be changed at any time. Thus, this business model allows operators to provide a short time to market for products that are demanded by subscribers.   The more complex model represents a marketplace where mobile network operators, even those who do not have roaming agreements, interact securely and directly, without any complex integrations or intermediaries. These operators use multi-account SIM cards and allow their subscribers to upload local mobile profiles over-the-air, i.e. via encrypted special binary SMS messages or the data channel using an SMDP platform (eSIM standard). Thus, while travelling, subscribers can purchase service packages at the rates of local operators and use their existing SIM cards.   To speed up implementation of these business models, Clementvale Baltic OÜ is developing a blockchain-based platform and participating in standardisation of Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT). Our company continues to actively develop these business models and offer them to players in the telecom market.  Read the full story here: https://news.itu.int/clementvale-new-business-models/

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Clementvale Baltic OÜ Becomes an ITU Member to Pioneer Innovative Technologies in Telecom  Clementvale Baltic OÜ has become an Associate member of the ITU Telecommunication Standardization Sector (ITU-T) to progress the development of international standards for innovative technologies in the telecom industry.  Clementvale Baltic OÜ has joined ITU-T’s Study Group 2 that works on operational aspects of service provision and telecommunication management. As part of this group, Clementvale Baltic OÜ plans to actively participate in studies and development of the standards that are related to the following areas: principles of service provision; the operational impact of the Internet, services and infrastructure convergence and new services, such as OTT and M2M/IoT, on international telecommunication services and networks; management architecture and security, and others.  “We are honoured to join ITU and be among the pioneers who will lay down all necessary standards for promising technologies in telecom. Those who set the standards will be playing a key role in the implementation of new technologies into the whole industry.  We believe that our expertise will help to make a significant contribution to the standardization process as our team has already developed a blockchain-based platform. We are also ready to offer turnkey business models for joint elaboration”, said Jaanus Kikas, Management Board Adviser.  As modern technologies are rapidly changing, currently, there are good prospects for development of new technologies related to connection of various devices and new business models for distribution of mobile services that require blockchain technology, remote SIM provisioning (RSP) and eSIM standards.  Clementvale Baltic OÜ aims to provide easy and convenient access to mobile services as well as to participate in the development of new market segments by creating a global marketplace.  Read the full story here: https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/clementvale-baltic-o%C3%BC-becomes-an-itu-member-to-pioneer-innovative-technologies-in-telecom-cad66486e834  https://www.itu.int/online/mm/scripts/gensel11?_memb=A

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone and Nexign Introduced TeleChain Broker at Mobile World Congress 2019  Bubbletone and Nexign participated in Mobile World Congress 2019, the key event of the global telecom industry, that took place in Barcelona on February 25–28. The team members of both companies showcased together TeleChain Broker — the joint solution based on BSS and blockchain technologies that enables digital service providers to get access to new revenue streams.   Mobile World Congress is the largest mobile event in the world that brought together the latest innovations and leading-edge technology from more than 2,400 companies and more than 109,000 visitors from over 198 countries, including more than 7,900 CEOs. The worldwide meeting consisted of the exhibition of MWC technological innovations and the conference with the participation of important persons in the field of telecommunications and IT.   Among the participants were leading telecom companies such as Telefonica, Orange, Vodafone, AT&T, MTS, China Telecom, Telecom Argentina, Turkcell, MTN Group Limited, and many others.   At the company’s booth, Bubbletone’s CEO Yuri Morozov, Project Director Alexander Yakovenko, and PR Director Julia Shabunina, as well as Nexign’s Director of Network Monetization Products Alexey Vedin and Integration Projects Manager Sergey Sosin, introduced TeleChain Broker to the audience and explained what benefits it brings to digital service providers worldwide.   TeleChain (Telecom Blockchain) Broker is a blockchain-based marketplace for digital service providers with a BSS connectivity kit that provides the opportunity to create new roaming products and complex bundles, including digital non-telco services.   Read the full story here: https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/bubbletone-and-nexign-introduced-telechain-broker-at-mobile-world-congress-2019-5a89c1c11c9b

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Dear Bubbletone followers,  We highly appreciate your active participation in the forum. We will continue to inform you about all the news. For your attention the questions and answers that were announced during the AMA session:  Q: Who is your potential competitor? A: The best world's project were described in the recent article published on Forbes  Q: Who are your potential partners apart from Shocard? A: At the moment, we don't develop deep cooperation with Shocard because we're developing our own solution for clients validation. The main problem within this solution has been solved, namely the opportunity to recognize various  lines from various documents. This option allows users not to type their personal details, exclude errors and manual labor of operators to retype the clients data from pdf copies documents. Also now we are working on implementation of mechanism for comparison of  selfie photos and passport photos. It is necessary to meet requirements of a number of mobile operators.  We are now working on PoC with SiMYO and several other mobile operators. Our potential partners are all mobile operators, especially small and medium ones (like MVNOs) and other service providers (insurance companies, booking companies, content providers - for example, TV, music, business apps etc.). Kasko2go, an insurance company, is our current partner and they will launch their project next year. And after that we will be able to integrate them into our system.  When it comes to telecom, we are working with Simyo (spanish MVNO operator), Mobily (SA MNO operator), Venta Mobile (Latvia), Mobifone (Vietnam). AT the moment PoC procedure is  passed with one of them and we will implement this procedure with others. We have a list of partners who are not ready to announce their names until the PoC successfully complete. We consider Nexign to be one of the most  important strategic partners. Nexign is one of the biggest companies that provide BSS (billing systems) for mobile operators. This company fully understands how the billing systems work and they help us to create low level API  of our BlockChain for integration of our BlockCHain part  into BSS of mobile operators. AT the moment, all our main BlockChain resources are focused on creation of this API.  This will allow mobile operators to  quickly implement to our platform. We hope to show real ready industrial use case during GSMA mobile world congress in Barcelona at the end of February on our joint booth.  Q: Do you have any plans to develop your own Blockchain or will remain in Ethereum? A: When it comes to the platform, we are developing a private blockchain for a special group of users - an industrial blockchain for telecom operators and service providers. This blockchain is for professional market players. Based on Graphene, it has very high performance .  Q: We invested in the whole “BubbleTone” which is in use in Russia currently “without” UMT. In previous posts from the BubbleTone team, only certain functions and or features explained as “certain services within BubbleTone App” will use “UMT”. Stated after the fact of investing. A: Nowadays the app of such level is very complicated and requires time for many integrations. First integration was with a Russian operator, that's why  their clients can call to PSTN using the balance within this operator. Also the development of the web-version of the BubbleTone has been taking a lot of time. We hope it will be available soon.  We have implemented a number of telecom functions into the app (e.g . conversion of voice codec OPUS into G.729, integration with our own SMS-server, etc.) and we have a delay with implementation  of personal balances into the app. As soon as the personal balances are implemented, the SIP out calls for other participants will be available. We hope it will take place in the first quarter 2019.  Q: What happened to your test with 'Virgin' Russia? A: Virgin Connect uses profiles that are not compatible with our our applet. As a result, the tests are suspended until we find a solution.  Q: Where are we in 6 months? I see no exchange trading action and increase, I don’t even know how much each umt is worth. A: During this time, the team was focused on negotiations with operators and the platform development. We do not expect the trading activity to increase until the token gets its utility purpose. You can find the UMT price here: https://www.livecoinwatch.com/price/Bubbletone-UMT  When it comes to UMT and token-economy - there were many questions about it. First of all, we're focused on the development of the platform and its launch. Secondly, we're working on our app. This app is a possible interface for operators. THE APP IS NOT BLOCKCHAIN-BASED. It will allow subscribers to choose and pay for offers. It is operators who use blockchain to make deals. When the platform is launched, more operators will be integrated into the platform and UMT token will get more value because it will be utilized and in demand.  Q: Where is your HP announcement? A: At the beginning, we planned to recommend operators to use HP equipment for nodes, but operators refused as they consider this to be protectionism.  Q: What was the treasury management of the funds raised during the ICO? Does the company still have enough fund to build the project (aka, did they cash out ETH into fiat or did they just hodl the ETH)? A: At the beginning of our ico, one ETH was 1350$. As of now, it's lower than 100$. The main amount of funds we received during the pre-ICO stage. As you can see, the exchange rate has significantly changed. The  organisation of ICO-process required a lot of money. We participated in many events and it was really expensive. The rest of the funds has been allocated to R&D. Our product is complicated, it requires time and resources, both human and financial. We have also allocated  a part of our resources to create joint solution with Nexign. As i mentioned above, we are going to showcase this solution in Barcelona in February 2019. Besides during the whole year the exchange rate was getting worse and worse, but we stored money on the accounts,  from which we received them. We have been spending funds  on an as-needed basis.  There are no standards of blockchain in the world. We understand necessity of  developing standards in this innovative technology. That's why we participate in different international organisations, such as ITU, TM Forum, SAMENA Council. In ITU we actively participate in the Focus Group on DLT. This process also requires many resources, both human and financial.  During the ICO we concluded several SWAP agreements. Once these companies are listed on exchanges and unlock our part of tokens we are going to partially sell them.  For our project to function fully and normally, we need to cooperate with banks, which take money from mobile operators and convert them to SDR tokens. There are no banks who are ready to do it now. That is why we have decided to establish our own payment institution which requires EMI (e-money license). It's very important task, it will take at least 6-8 month and additional investments.  We are also working on SDK for iOS and Android to let other operators integrate our application into their applications, as they want to promote their services using functionality of the Bubbletone appbuild in their apps. We are going to rewrite our WP in quarter 1 2019. As for the roadmap it will be rewritten by the end of this year.  Q: What is the current circulating supply of UMT? A: The circulating supply is 160 069 319, 28.  Q: How much % of UMT supply is still locked and when will all unlock? A: About 412 mln  (appr. 72%) of UMT supply is locked. All of them will be unlocked in 24 months (starting from september 2018). 3 %  is unlocked every month.   Q: Can you explained the top holders in etherscan? A: The biggest holder is Network development fund (locked for 24 months). No tokens are used from this fund now. From the very beginning the project was not focused on speculators. This a long-term project. We are not going to dump our token, we are going to work hard and to increase the token value and make the platform up and running.  We'll try to inform you more often about all the changes in R&D of Bubbletone platform. We'll have our roadmap corrected by the end of this year. We will updated our WP in Q1 2019. We kindly ask you to be patient.

Author: zengis
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: How does Bubbletone work, is it the same as Social Media Messaging that is currently popular. I have seen applications that already exist in each of the mobile operating systems and are not much different from the current social messaging.

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Hello zengis! Do you mean the Bubbletone Messenger?  BubbleTone is a new generation messenger with 100+ useful features. Customized for the needs of mobile operators, the messenger provides additional revenue streams on voice calls and SMS messages from the app and other telecom services.  There are some unique features: 1.Audio and video calls. 2.Group chats and SMS chats 3.Burning messages after reading. 4.Sending messages to the future. 5.Sending SMS from the messenger onto GSM network.          6. Stickers and animations. 7. Sharing photos, videos and large files. 8. Record voice messages with pre-listening. 9. Request geolocation of subscriber and contacts. 10. One account for multiple devices with message synchronization and built-in cloud storage.  In the future we are planning to develop new functionality for the Bubbletone messenger as a part of Bubbletone Blockchain: 1. A technical capacity to buy a virtual number in 60 countries around the world and order communication packages in 100+ countries around the world, according to their local tariff plans 2.The ability to enable automatic selection of the carrier by the criteria of price or quality of communication services 3.Access to an independent rating of mobile services provided by the carriers. Each user can estimate the quality with one “click” in the Bubbletone messenger, and his/her choice will be recorded inside the Blockchain 4. Make P2P payments in crypto and fiat currency around the globe 5. With a built-in voting platform based on the blockchain, users can organize voting contests, business meetings, and give honest ratings to products and services 6. Videoconferences with a large number of participants. The conference call is already available at Bubbletone. You start with calling the first subscriber and then add the next, etc. On the WebRTC (desktop version) audio and video conference will be implemented.

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Current Status on the Platform Development  Dear community members,  We would like to summarise the results of the expiring year and inform all of you about the progress in the platform development.  Upon the completion of the ICO, the Bubbletone team had a test version of the blockchain-based platform. Since that moment, our development team has been working on a production version of the platform. The launch of the production version is planned for Q1 2019. For the launch to take place, we are going to deploy approximately 15 nodes.  PoC  We have also been conducting a proof of concept (PoC) with several mobile operators. PoC is a demonstration, the purpose of which is to verify that our concept has the potential for real-world application.  Implementation of PoC is a complex process accompanied by a number of technical difficulties. For the main use cases, which are the most claimed by operators, PoC can be described in the following simplified way:  Read the full story here:  https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/current-status-on-the-platform-development-e2d5749bf8a9

Body: Bubbletone Partners with Nexign to Deliver Revolutionary Blockchain Solution for Telcos  Bubbletone and Nexign have announced an exclusive partnership to develop an industry-first blockchain-based Business Support Systems (BSS) solution for the telecom sector. Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Do you know how much this idea is great? Do a little Google then you will find that these big names interested in the idea:  I: Deloitte - https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/Deloitte/za/Documents/technology-media-telecommunications/za_TMT_Blockchain_TelCo.pdf II: IBM - https://developer.ibm.com/patterns/blockchain-for-telecom-roaming-fraud-and-overage-management/  I think Bubbletone is the pioneer and hopefully will start the first public blockchain in telecom before 2019.  Here are the reasons:  A: MVP (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hlUXrBEw3y0) B: Blockchain is developed on Graphene (https://github.com/Clementvale-LTD/blockchain-telecom.graphene-core) C: App is developed and recently updated (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.countrycom.bubbletone&hl=en) D: Millions of dollars collected to fund the idea (https://icobench.com/ico/bubbletone) E: A new operator established (https://bubblefon.ru/) and currently is working F: Team tirelessly present the product all over the world (30 event just in 2018) G: Right partners are selected (https://www.lightreading.com/oss-bss/bss-(inc-billing-revenue-assurance)/nexign-bubbletone-to-develop-blockchain-based-bss-system/d/d-id/745346) & (https://www.horizoncomm.co)  I understand from the above evidences that hopefully the team will successfully start the blockchain before 2019 and maybe the roaming free service in 2019. The effect will be huge, and the price could up XXX even before we get any announcement, so if one wants to invest I believe today is the right time. Having a good idea and building a team then implementing, promoting, running the project are totally different things, all know how this is hard to do that in current bearish market.  Keep Up  This Q&A is a little old but still worth https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k8CUOFtlzQI

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone and SIMYO to Launch a Pilot Project  Bubbletone and SIMYO, a major MVNO in Spain, have signed a memorandum of understanding to establish a partnership and implement a pilot project regarding the use of blockchain technology in commercialization of telecom services — abroad communications mobile products for Spain incoming roamers.   According to the memorandum, the companies will establish a working group of designated responsible persons for research, development, and advancement of the blockchain pilot project. The group will set up an experimental zone for the “Distribution of prepaid mobile services with zero acquisition cost” use case.   “SIMYO is convinced that Blockchain is a key technology for the present and for the future; especially in the Telecom Market. New business opportunities are appearing based on Blockchain and SIMYO will be in the state of art for these new operations accordingly with our innovative approach in product development. This pilot project with Bubbletone will help us to explore how to spread our commercial offering abroad, to new customers coming to visit Spain”, said Jesus Noguera, CEO at SIMYO.   Read the full story here: https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/bubbletone-and-simyo-to-launch-a-pilot-project-fdcda30ae95e

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Hi! As you can see, there is no such function in our application. Like other messengers, Bubbletone requests access to your contacts and shows exactly those contacts from your address book who has the installed messenger (contacts who can communicate with you via Bubbletone messenger). Hide the fact that you have installed a messenger from other users of the Bubbletone messenger is impossible. On the other hand, if you make a call to PSTN (landline numbers or mobile numbers), you can call anyone you want. The only thing I remind you is that this is a paid function.

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: BubbleTone: New Version Released  BubbleTone is a new generation messenger with 100+ useful features. Customized for the needs of mobile operators, the messenger provides additional revenue streams on voice calls and SMS messages from the app and other telecom services.  The Bubbletone team is glad to announce that a new version of our messenger has been released on October 26.  We have fixed a number of software bugs to make it easier  to use the application. So, what has been changed, exactly?  Interface  The first/main tab now contains a list of calls that a user has made, answered or missed;  New icons for the “make a call within the Bubbletone network” (peer-to-peer calls) and “make a call to PSTN” options;  The option “save gender information” in the “personal information” section in a user’s personal account now works properly;  The last message sent or received by the user now stays visible, even while the user is typing a new message with the pop-up keyboard;  There are a number of Android phones that have the following defect: their proximity sensors do not work properly. As a result, when calls came in, the screens of these phones would go black. This problem has been solved;  The settings menu includes a section called “additional info”. Among other information, this section includes the user’s Bubbletone number and balance. The Bubbletone number is the number which the user receives after they have signed an agreement with an operator. In the previous app version, this information disappeared from time to time. This problem has been solved.  Read the full story here:  https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/bubbletone-new-version-released-a2788646cdaf

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Hi there! Just to let you know, access to contacts is needed to send peer-to-peer messages and make peer-to-peer calls (from the messenger user to the messenger user). Calls to the PSTN (to a subscriber’s mobile number or to a landline number) are paid features that are currently available only to customers of those operators who are integrated into the Bubbletone system. If you do not want to provide access to your contacts, what are you planning to use a messenger for? You will not be able to communicate with the messenger users. In this case, you have to install paid functionality.

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone Becomes a Member of Samena Telecommunications Council  Bubbletone First Member of SAMENA Council with Dedicated Focus on Blockchain Development  SAMENA Telecommunications Council has announced that Bubbletone, a wholly-owned brand of Clementvale, has joined its membership with the purpose of contributing to building the blockchain ecosystem in the South Asia — Middle East — North Africa region. Both SAMENA Council, as an operator interest and advocacy industry body and Bubbletone, as an emerging leader in blockchain technology, especially targeting an improved cross-border communication experience for telecom operators’ customers, view the need for digital transformation and value-creation in this age of digital economy through blockchain among elemental steps toward equipping telecom operators to enhance their customers’ digital experience and revenues.  About SAMENA Telecommunications Council Founded in 2006, SAMENA Telecommunications Council is a tri-regional, non-profit telecommunications association that embodies a community of South Asian, Middle Eastern, and North African telecoms operators, manufacturers, regulatory authorities, and academia. SAMENA aims to be the ultimate promoter of collaboration and knowledge-sharing in the SAMENA region that spans over 25 countries, including Afghanistan, Algeria, Bahrain, Bangladesh, Egypt, Iran, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Morocco, Nepal, Oman, Pakistan, Palestine, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Sri Lanka, Sudan, Syria, Tunisia, Turkey, United Arab Emirates, and Yemen.  Read the full story here: https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/bubbletone-becomes-a-member-of-samena-telecommunications-council-19a6df16fde0

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone to Participate in the ITU-T FG DLT  Bubbletone’s Project Director Alexander Yakovenko and Lead Blockchain Software Architect Sergey Maltsev will take part in the ITU Telecommunication Standardisation Sector (ITU-T) Focus Group on the Application of Distributed Ledger Technology (FG DLT). The meeting of the group will be held in Beijing, China, on October 9–12.   Blockchain and distributed ledger technologies (DLT) are proving applicable to a wide range of business operations. DLT use cases are emerging in many sectors, with the telecom industry being no exception. However, standards have not been set in this industry. That’s why DLT is now under an in-depth study in ITU standardization work on security and trust, identity management, environmental sustainability, protocols, and test specifications. As full members of FG DLT, the Bubbletone team is actively participating in this work.   At the meeting, the team members will be presenting particular use cases and participating in relevant discussions.   Read the full story here: https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/bubbletone-to-participate-in-the-itu-t-fg-dlt-82de92b158a4

Body: Bubbletone to Showcase its BIockchain-based Platform at GITEX Technology Week 2018  Bubbletone will participate in GITEX Technology Week 2018 — the biggest and boldest technology show in MENA and South Asia — that will take place in Dubai on October 14-18. The Bubbletone team will present its decentralized platform for the telecom industry to investors and industry experts and enter pitch competitions.   The Bubbletone team will take part in GITEX Future Stars,  a segment of GITEX for startups only, and represent the newly-formed Blockchain sector. This region’s biggest startup show (850+ startups from 75+ countries and across 19 sectors) provides its participants with opportunities to pitch for funding, find a route to market and scale up their operations by pertaining with governments, global investors, established technology companies and the private sector.  Among the investors will be prominent organizations from Europe, Asia, and Silicon Valley such as Amazon, Google Ventures, NorthZone, 01 ventures, European Business Angel Network, MustardSeedVC, Middle East Venture Partners (MEVP), Rising Fund Tide, and others. Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone to Showcase its Blockchain-based Platform for Mobile Operators at CIS 2018 GCCM   Bubbletone will attend CIS 2018 Global Carrier Community Meeting that will be held in Almaty, Kazakhstan, on September 4–5. Bubbletone’s Project Director Alexander Yakovenko will present the Bubbletone blockchain-based platform and ecosystem to the telecommunications industry players in the CIS region.   Organized by Carrier Community (CC) – an exclusive global telecom club and industry-networking platform for wholesale telecom service providers, CIS 2018 Global Carrier Community Meeting is the 2nd annual global carrier community event in CIS for 2018. The event will bring together more than 350+ club participants representing 150+ regional and international telecom operators.  Among the participants will be such key CIS  industry players as Kazakhtelecom, Rostelecom, China Telecom, Türk Telekom International, CITIC Telecom CPC, LANCK Telecom, MGI and many others.   Read the full story here: https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/bubbletone-to-showcase-its-blockchain-based-platform-for-mobile-operators-at-cis-2018-gccm-8667c008f195

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Heavy Reading: Bubbletone is one of the Leading Blockchain Technology Vendors  Heavy Reading, one of the most authoritative media in telecom, has published a detailed report on what relevance blockchain has for the telecom industry. The report profiles seven blockchain technology vendors with interesting propositions in the market — Bubbletone has the first position in the list.  Called Blockchain Opportunities for CSPs: Separating Hype From Reality, the report explores the drivers for adoption of blockchain by communications service providers (CSPs) and evaluates the main opportunities for blockchain in the telecom sector. It also considers how to evaluate whether blockchain is appropriate for a particular use case and examines the main use cases that CSPs are investing in currently.  Read the full story here: https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/heavy-reading-bubbletone-is-one-of-the-leading-blockchain-technology-vendors-2c701f6c4fa6

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone Presents its Technological Solution for Mobile Operators at CIS 2018 GCCM  Bubbletone participated in CIS 2018 Global Carrier Community Meeting that was held in Almaty, Kazakhstan, on September 4–5. Bubbletone’s Project Director Alexander Yakovenko showcased the Bubbletone blockchain-based platform to mobile operators in the CIS region.  After Bubbletone’s Project Director  Alexander Yakovenko delivered a speech on prospects and benefits of blockchain technology implementation in telecom, a number of operators showed intense interest in Bubbletone’s technological solution. Among them were Sky Mobile (Kyrgyzstan), Kazakhtelecom (Kazakhstan), Lmt (Latvia), Aryacell (Iran), Miatel (Russia), Veon Group and others. Alexander provided some of these operators with SIM cards to give them an opportunity to run tests. He also made arrangements for meetings with operators to discuss potential collaboration.   Read the full story here: https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/bubbletone-presents-its-technological-solution-for-mobile-operators-at-cis-2018-gccm-cfb6ea1d8784

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone and Nexign Presented Their Joint Solution at Telecoms World Middle East 2018  Bubbletone and Nexign participated in Telecoms World Middle East 2018 — the largest telecoms conference in the Middle East that brought together operators from across the globe in Dubai on September 17-18. The team members of both companies showcased their joint solution based on both BSS and blockchain technologies that enables telecoms operators to leverage new monetisation streams by attracting new clients and providing new types of services to the industry decision makers.  Focused on the digital transformation, technology developments and the future landscape for MNOs, MVNOs, OTTs, suppliers and the wider industry, the event is a large networking platform for the entire TMT ecosystem. The conference assembled over 1000 attendees, 200 speakers, 75 sponsors and exhibitors from not only the Middle East, but also North Africa, East Africa, Central, and South Asia.  Among the participants were telecom titans such as Turk Telekom,Tunisie Telecom, Afghan Telecom Company, PT Telekomunikasi Indonesia International (Telin), Telecom Oman (TeO), China Telecom (Africa & Middle East) Limited MEA, Sri Lanka Telecom, Virgin Mobile Middle East & Africa, Omantel, Bakcell, Etisalat Group, Renna Mobile, TuneTalk, Roshan, and many others.  Read the full story here: https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/bubbletone-and-nexign-presented-their-joint-solution-at-telecoms-world-middle-east-2018-923cd33f272f

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: How blockchain can improve telecom business support systems  By ITU News  Telecom platform Bubbletone and software and services provider Nexign recently partnered to apply blockchain to the business support systems that manage telecom companies’ operations. ITU News caught up with Yuri Morozov, CEO and Founder of Bubbletone Blockchain for Telecom, about how blockchain can modernize the industry.  Why is Bubbletone partnering with Nexign to apply blockchain to business support systems (BSS) for telecom operators?  The joint solution will allow operators to get access to blockchain technology and make offers for new clients in parallel with current business processes.   The partnership with Nexign gives Bubbletone an opportunity to attract more operators to the ecosystem  without any additional expertise from the operator’s side. Nexign provides any operator with an easy start, even if the operator’s BSS, network switching subsystem (NSS), and security systems have strict development limitations.   Read the full interview here:  https://news.itu.int/blockchain-telecom-business-support-systems/

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone to Determine the Impact of its Technological Solution on the Virgin Connect Business  Bubbletone and Virgin Connect, a Russian telecom company with a global brand name, have signed a memorandum to establish partnership aimed at implementing blockchain technology in the telecom business.  According to the memorandum, the companies will establish a working group of designated responsible individuals for research, development and advancement of the blockchain-based solution. The working group will choose and test several use cases developed by Bubbletone. Then the group members will collaboratively prepare and showcase real-life use cases, with the demonstration of mobile profiles interactions and engagement with value-added services on the Bubbletone blockchain platform being included.  The testing results will help to build an analysis regarding the overall revenue generated by the implementation of the Bubbletone blockchain solution into the Virgin Connect business. Once the business opportunity has been demonstrated, the companies will sign an agreement on implementation of Bubbletone’s solution into the Virgin Connect business.  Read the full story here: https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/bubbletone-to-determine-the-impact-of-its-technological-solution-on-the-virgin-connect-business-ec861b0ad237

Author: gribble
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone Showcases its Technological Solution for Telecom at GSR-18  Bubbletone took part in the 18th Global Symposium for Regulators (GSR)  that was held in Geneva, Switzerland, on July 9–12.   Organised by the International Telecommunication Union (ITU), the Global Symposium for Regulators is a prominent event for the world of telecom that is aimed at facilitating the exchange of experience between regulators and respectively between them and the representatives of electronic communications industry leaders worldwide.  Bubbletone was the only blockchain-based project, whose CBDO had been invited to participate in a panel discussion on digital transformation in telecom.  As a panelist at the “Industry Leaders as Drivers of Leading Emerging Technologies” session, Bubbletone's CBDO Oleg Pravdin delivered a speech on prospects and benefits of blockchain technology implementation in telecom and showcased the Bubbletone project to the key industry players. His speech aroused intense interest and was followed by a number of questions.  Look at the photos and read the full story here:   https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/bubbletone-showcases-its-technological-solution-for-telecom-at-gsr-18-eb354036e27f

Author: gij
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Yes, I think the most important thing is development right now, If team be able to do what they have promised regarding their road-map the price will recover in a short period, I am curious about latest progresses in development phase, now we are on Q3-2018 and the only meaningful blog about their progress is this one (Jun 27) :  https://medium.com/bubbletone-blockchain-in-telecom/it-is-time-to-talk-about-what-we-have-already-done-for-the-development-of-our-project-651aeb04295a  DONE: * The initial version of the smart contract is ready * The first requests and offers of services are already placed on the blockchain platform * Integration of the application with the main e-sim platforms for loading mobile profiles on SIM cards is done. Now doing: - Developing a Web-API for the integration of applications with mobile operators and service providers. - Introducing digital identification technology into the operation of Bubbletone application - Launch commercial operation with the offers of more than a dozen operators on the blockchain. And then: Very soon, participants of Bubbletone platform will be able to take advantage of low prices for mobile services operating in more than 80 countries!  Really the above tasks was scheduled for Q2, so I hope as they have already promised, soon we get more important development updates.

Author: gribble
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Yes i hope umt will be listed on binance too and here is the latest updating about the ICO of bubbletone: BUBBLETONE COLLECTS $8.6 MILLION VIA ICO AND SUCCESSFULLY TESTS PROPRIETARY ROAMING-FREE SIM CARD  The blockchain-based global telecom platform Bubbletone has successfully completed its ICO, collecting $8.6 million. All Universal Mobile Tokens (UMT) will be issued to crowdsale participants by 10 July.   Soon the company plans the market launch of an original roaming-free Bubbletone SIM card that developers are already actively testing in the US and Europe. In addition, a Bubbletone affiliate – Baltic Clementvale LTD – has applied for admission to the International Telecommunications Union (ITU) and received an MVNO license. As a result, Bubbletone will be able to create its own offers for clients in the European market of telecommunication services. UMT token holders will be able to enjoy these and many other innovative benefits.  Read the full story here: http://bitcoinist.com/bubbletone-collects-8-6-million-via-ico-and-successfully-tests-proprietary-roaming-free-sim-card/

Author: Triop
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone Launches its own MVNO Service in Europe  Baltic Clementvale LTD, an Estonian branch of Clementvale LTD, has received an MVNO license and applied for membership in the International Telecom Union (ITU). Bubbletone will be able to produce its own offers for clients in the European telecom market.  Baltic Clementvale LTD, an Estonian branch of Clementvale LTD (an operating company that goes by the brand name Bubbletone), has received an MVNO license. In the nearest future, Bubbletone will be able to publish its own offers on the telecom market in Europe. The new mobile operator is named Clementvale Baltic OÜ, with its license number being  STO000404.

Author: NightDream
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Digital technologies are a part of modern life    Today, offices can not be imagined without a local network and Internet access and its employees without smartphones. Mobile communication allows to organize audio and video conference with remote units and employees located outside the office. However, now these opportunities are desirable to use only within one country. Otherwise, international roaming will break a solid gap in the budget of any company.  The team Bubbletone has been working on the Telecom market for over 18 years and understands its needs. First of all, we are talking about low-cost international communication. The problem is solved through blockchain technologies. Bubbletone Blockchain will allow operators to abandon expensive roaming technologies and reduce the fee for their services without losing the quality of communication. https://medium.com/@bubbletone/digital-technologies-are-a-part-of-modern-life-f69199ae187f

Author: LoganAlan
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: A New Mobile Operator Launched on the Basis of Bubbletone app  A new mobile operator — Bubblephone — has been launched on the basis of the Bubbletone app. The new operator subscribers will be able to use mobile services at local region prices while travelling both around Russia and all over the world.  The key features of the Bubblephone project are as follows: the network subscribers do not need to purchase a new SIM-card and they are provided with communication services at local prices not only in Russia, but also while travelling around the world.

Body: Bubbletone Partners up with Kasko2Go Bubbletone (the operating company Clementvale Ltd) has concluded a partnership agreement with Kasko2Go (the operating company Go2solution) — a company that develops software solutions in the field of auto insurance. According to the agreement, Kasko2Go will utilize the Bubbletone platform as an innovative solution to distribute its online car insurance services and provide access to the Bubbletone platform for their clients. As for Bubbletone, it will provide Kasko2Go’s clients with the opportunity to use high-quality mobile communication and Internet services at the rates of local operators using their existing SIM card all over the globe. Author: filsid
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: International roaming is expensive https://medium.com/@bubbletone/international-roaming-is-expensive-7e0182545c9f    Literally two decades mobile communication was affordable to very few people. Today, a cell phone is a mandatory attribute of modern man. However, in the international market communication is still expensive which makes travelers during the trip to abandon the usual number. As a result people feel discomfort, having lost the usual service, and mobile operators lose customers and profits.  The emergence of blockchain technology means a new stage in the evolution of cellular communication. The team Bubbletone has developed an ecosystem which will cancel the roaming charges. Bubbletone Blockchain will allow regional mobile operators to enter the global market without complex and expensive technical integration, and accordingly to reduce the cost of international calls. In other words, the global Telecom market will become available for small and medium-sized operators.

Author: pikebu
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: DEHEDGE IS NOW OFFERING BUBBLETONE UMT TOKENS WITH 100% RISK PROTECTION!  The alt-telecom ecosystem Bubbletone has joined forces with DeHedge to offer protection against potential cancellations of token sales. The two companies have signed a contract for the equivalent of $1 million in Bubbletone’s UMT tokens; this is the first time in crypto history that a fintech company has offered 100% hedging for a project. Bubbletone investors can purchase hedged UMT tokens on the DeHedge platform or at https://bubbletone.io by using a designated button in their personal accounts.  Read the full story here: https://en.bitnovosti.com/2018/06/08/dehedge-and-bubbletone-launch-a-system-of-risk-secure-crypto-trading/

Author: filsid
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: 95% of ICOs claim to be blockchain projects …. But, it’s not true https://medium.com/@bubbletone/95-of-icos-claim-to-be-blockchain-projects-but-its-not-true-73bf3d9a8b15  Bobby Lee co-founder of the oldest Chinese currency exchange BTCC said that it is necessary to distinguish blockchain projects and databases.  According to Bobby Lee: “… Everyone using a digital ledger is calling it Blockchain, w/o regards to functionality. Complete intellectual dishonesty!”. This statement is consonant with the recent comments of the famous “bitcoin evangelist” Andreas Antonopoulos, who noted that insufficiently decentralized detachments are unattractive.  Antonopoulos is sure that the technology without decentralized principles was a “very bad database.”  Lee also added that: “95% of ICOs claim to be blockchain projects, although in fact they are just databases …. All data going into the Blockchain needs to be independently & publicly verifiable .”

Author: pikebu
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Hey BubbleTone Community In today's article they are going to tell you about "Why will users of mobile networks use Bubbletone?" Bubbletone platform, based on blockchain technology, connects subscribers and mobile operators directly. In the future they plan to use this platform to enter the international market, offering it to operators around the world. Author: AnnaYes
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone is a blockchain startup that is building a decentralized telecom ecosystem to connect end consumers and telcos directly. In layman terms, Bubbletone is looking to eliminate the bottlenecks in today’s data roaming standards by using the blockchain to allow users to make calls at extremely low costs and at the same time, dramatically lower the fees for data roaming all across the world. Bubbletone is not only aiming to benefit consumers; telcos and service providers can also use the platform’s features to expand their network and reach globally without having to go through costly and complicated processes in today’s network integration architecture.  Simply put, Bubbletone aims to put a stop or at least cut down on the issues prevalent in the modern telecommunications industry.Bubbletone is a blockchain startup that is building a decentralized telecom ecosystem to connect end consumers and telcos directly. In layman terms, Bubbletone is looking to eliminate the bottlenecks in today’s data roaming standards by using the blockchain to allow users to make calls at extremely low costs and at the same time, dramatically lower the fees for data roaming all across the world.    Bubbletone is not only aiming to benefit consumers; telcos and service providers can also use the platform’s features to expand their network and reach globally without having to go through costly and complicated processes in today’s network integration architecture.  Simply put, Bubbletone aims to put a stop or at least cut down on the issues prevalent in the modern telecommunications industry.  As mentioned earlier, the entire basis of Bubbletone is to directly connect mobile network operators and end consumers on the platform’s blockchain-based marketplace.  To begin, any mobile carrier across the world can offer their own prepaid tariff plans on Bubbletone as smart contracts; these offers are aptly named “Offers” and are visible to all operators and users of the Bubbletone platform.  Whenever an offer is selected, a “Request” smart contract will be created to process the request. The smart contract contains the identity of the user who requested as well as payment information in regards to the offer.  Once the mobile carrier receives a request for their offer, they will identify the user who requested, accept the payment from the smart request, and then begin to service the user who now has access to the carrier’s services.  Bubbletone also allows non-mobile carriers such as cloud TV companies or music streaming services to use Bubbletone as a way to offer subscriptions to users.  Transactions in Bubbletone are done with the Universal Mobile Token (UMT) token, the platform’s official cryptocurrency. UMT tokens are used to pay for telco services in Bubbletone and they are also used as payments for sending messages or making calls in the Bubbletone messenger app.

Author: AnnaYes
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Dear friends!  We're glad to inform you that our ICO is live and there is 17 days left until the end! Hurry up to participate in it and catch your ticket to the moon!  Here are some news from our Bubbletone Weekly Newsletter:  1) During 3 Pre-ICO stages and our live ICO stage we've already collected 50% of our hard cap! Hurry up to catch your lucky ticket to the moon with Bubbletone! You can participate in our ICO just right now: www.ico.bubbletone.io  2) Our team: CEO Yury Morozov, CCO Kirill Maskaev and Project Manager Maria Voronova participated in IOTX Conference and Exhibition in Dubai yesterday and we're glad to share some photo: https://medium.com/@bubbletone/our-team-ceo-yury-morozov-cco-kirill-maskaev-and-project-manager-maria-voronova-participated-in-c1c689c4adc2  3) Also our team participated in Future Blockchain Summit in Dubai and during this conference our CCO Kirill Maskaev took part in panel discussion "Blockchain's impact on a Communication Service Provider's operating model" - below the link you can find more photo and video:  https://medium.com/@bubbletone/bubbletone-cco-kirill-maskaev-took-part-in-panel-discussion-blockchains-impact-on-a-communication-8ef3e76a2024  4) Bubbletone CTO Oleg Pravin and CEO Yury Morozov participated in Telecom Leaders Summit 2018 in Samena Dubai Atlantis with Mats Granryd and Mr Brock Pierce!  During this event our team discussed our project with Mats Granryd - General Director and Board Member of GSMA. The GSMA represents the interests of mobile operators worldwide, uniting nearly 800 operators with more than 300 companies in the broader mobile ecosystem, including handset and device makers, software companies, equipment providers and internet companies, as well as organisations in adjacent industry sectors. The GSMA also produces industry-leading events such as  Mobile World Congress, Mobile World Congress Shanghai, Mobile World Congress Americas and the Mobile 360 Series conferences.  For more info and photo please follow the link: https://medium.com/@bubbletone/bubbletone-cto-oleg-pravin-and-ceo-yury-morozov-participated-in-telecom-leaders-summit-2018-in-c44212070ef2  Bubbletone team wish you a good may weekend and advise to stay tuned - great news are on the way!

Author: LumeenaThuwan
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Bubbletone project consists of two main parts: Blockchain and Mobile App Bubbletone replaces old-fashioned and costly roaming technology by implementing smart contracts into mobile operators' interactions. Any mobile carrier can publish prepaid plans as smart contracts on Bubbletone Blockchain. These offers are visible to all other operators and their subscribers. When subscriber selects offer, a new smart contract is created with the subscriber`s digital identity and payment transaction directly to foreign operator.

Author: pikebu
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Here the explanation about bubbletone's project and any other related with the bubbletone include the answer your question "Initially, they’re creating a community of small and medium-sized mobile operators that are looking for new services for their subscribers, such as global mobile coverage and value-added services, as well as new revenue streams on inbound tourists, Identity-as-a-Service and Voice-over-IP calls.  10+ operators with 20+M subscribers are ready for Proof of Concept (PoC) of the “Blockchain in Telecom” solution.  They have signed an agreement with world-famous English-learning service called “Lingualeo” to be connected to the Blockchain platform. It allows accepting SDR tokens to pay for language services as well as expanding sales channels via mobile operators.   They have become full member of the Crypto Valley Association. It is one of the world’s leading ecosystems established to develop crypto, blockchain and distributed ledger technologies.  They have signed partnership agreement with ShoCard Inc., the premier provider of blockchain-based identity verification. "

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: While our blockchain platform is still under development, we have already received several requests from existing business projects to transfer their business processes to our blockchain. We are negotiating with Orange and Vodafone and signed with LinguaLeo (English learning service) and 10+ mobile operators (Tesco Mobile (IE), Citic Telecom (HK), TruRoam Asia (AU) etc.) with 20+M subscribers who are totally ready for Proof of Concept (PoC) of the BubbleTone Blockchain in Telecom solution. They need stable token and a quick blockchain platform, and, like ourselves, they got tired of the many intermediaries that sometimes earn more than those who actually provide services and conduct business. Our project kills roaming just for a starter.

Author: koverot
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Hello,  My name is Tristan, and I am a sales executive for https://bounty0x.io/ , a platform designed to make bounty hosting simple for hosts and hunters alike. We have gathered a large network of bounty hosts and hunters, awarding over $10 million USD in bounties since launching this year.  Some companies that have completed bounty campaigns with bounty0x include AxPIre and Canya, while current bounties listed include companies like Wandx, Devery and SafeHaven.  We handle all types of bounties; Social media, Scammer Bounties (like the EtherDelta hacker bounty), bug bounties, and content platform. Basically bounties on anything you can think of.  Our platform hosts, reviews submissions, and distributes bounties via smart contract. This saves hiring costly bounty managers, huge man-hour spent reviewing submissions, manually distributing bounties. We take care of it all! If you have an existing bounty campaign, we can also easily port your campaign to our platform.  If you want to know more, visit our website https://bounty0x.io/. Currently I am able to help you list at 0 cost to your company. If you would like to discuss hosting a bounty campaign further, I am here to help.  Best Regards,  Tristan

Author: enhu
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: You will find most of their published report are in https://medium.com/@bubbletone  Quote from: Zeppelins on April 05, 2018, 05:02:54 PM Quote from: Pay4youractivity on April 05, 2018, 02:34:38 PM Quote from: Zeppelins on April 05, 2018, 06:21:33 AM I also tried the functionality of the application. The interface is pleasant enough for appearance and convenient to use. All calls and SMS are sent via the Internet. Something like that is in Skype. But the call comes exactly on the "original" sim card?  I did not try to call someone. I sent a few sms, and it went well. Yes, it is likely that no additional SIM cards are required, enough that that is being used now.  Didn't tried so much of its functionality too but most of the contacts I have on my phone were automatically listed on the bubbletone app which I guess would mean I can call or text them even when I'm abroad.

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Our service allows mobile operators to connect their subscribers to any other mobile operator in BubbleTone ecosystem, as well as sell their own services to a subscriber with different mobile operator if a subscriber chooses to use the service. As a result subscribers can use mobile network wherever they are and pay at local rates (LOCAL RATES) while operators can cut their costs and expand their audience of potential clients.

Author: Pay4youractivity
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: "About ShoCard ShoCard, Inc., based in Cupertino, Calif., is a mobile-identity platform built using blockchain technology that provides a simple and intuitive mobile application for definitive authentication while protecting users’ privacy. This allows for a variety of use cases, such as repeat authentication, true-digital signature with non-perishable audit-trail, transaction authorization to prevent fraud, frictionless login services without username/passwords, and user authentication in financial transactions, travel, health, government and industries where digital identity matters. www.shocard.com" Interesting partnership, I think it will be mutually beneficial.

Author: tilecuwi
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: The article makes think about the prospects of the telecom. If everything is implemented as described here, then all consumers will be happy: "In this new economy, operators will easily start launching attractive personalized roaming offers, stop losing revenue from silent roamers and unlock a whole new sales channel with an assortment of value-added services offered to their subscribers. This newly-created truly global cryptocurrency-based marketplace will directly connect end users and mobile networks and will be open to a wide range of large and small regional providers, who will no longer have to face a nearly insurmountable technological entry threshold. The introduction of blockchain-based tokens will be instrumental in bringing hundreds of potential new users into the fold and ensure the survival of the telecom industry, albeit in a new and better form more suitable for this new era."

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: While our blockchain platform is still under development, we have already received several requests from existing business projects to transfer their business processes to our blockchain. We are negotiating with Orange and Vodafone and signed with LinguaLeo (English learning service) and 10+ mobile operators (Tesco Mobile (IE), Citic Telecom (HK), TruRoam Asia (AU) etc.) with 20+M subscribers who are totally ready for Proof of Concept (PoC) of the BubbleTone Blockchain in Telecom solution. They need stable token and a quick blockchain platform, and, like ourselves, they got tired of the many intermediaries that sometimes earn more than those who actually provide services and conduct business.

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: We offer 2 kinds of deposits:  1. To secure a Super Node (highly efficient server) 1 mln. UMT deposit should be placed. Generated income is 1-2% from mining smarts paid in UMT starting Q2 2018.  2.  To secure a Mini Node (any computing device, even a smart phone; mini-nodes will assist operation of super-nodes) a deposit should be more than 1000 UMT. This will generate an income of 0.1-0.2% from mining smarts paid in UMT starting Q3 2018.

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: We implement Graphene. Graphene is extremely flexible, you can make smart contracts tailored for different service providers. Also Graphene is fast. We will be able to process more than 10K transactions per second. We have it tested.  Graphene is trusted and stable blockchain used in such well known projects as decentralized exchange BitShares, Steemit, Golos and EOS.  For more info please see our WP page 17: http://www.bubbletone.io/BubbleTone_Whitepaper_29Dec2017.pdf  We are closely following what is happening with existing technologies. Graphene is the most suitable blockchain for us so far. But if the number of transactions is so great that Graphene gets slow, we will move the platform to a faster technology. The main thing is to keep smart contracts.

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Mobile operators will benefit due to quick growth of provided services' volume. They will be able to quickly and without costly integration offer their subscribers global mobile coverage at local rates, start servicing traveling customers, offer their subscribers a unique competitive messenger app. We actively interacting with mobile operators in several countries.  Operators do not earn top dollar on roaming. High prices are related to high costs for roaming technology deployment and maintenance as well as high intermediator fees. The fact is that high roaming prices reduce the volume of communication services’ consumption. People use mobile less when in roaming just to save money.  The lower communication services cost for the user, the more he uses it. Thus, BubbleTone will help operators to sell more traffic.

Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Our equipment is manufactured and optimized by HP. One Node (Linux server) can process thousands of smart contracts per second. Detailed equipment requirements are listed in investment agreement with Node owners, general requirements are provided in our WP, page 19. The whole network will be based on equipment from HP.  After signing a partnership agreement with HP we'll post it on our site.

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Thank you for your involvement and attention to BubbleTone Blockchain in Telecom!  We would like to share important news about the remarkable project dynamics.  After showcasing BubbleTone’s fully operational blockchain at Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, we now see a growing interest coming from the large players in the telecom field.  We also did a number of dedicated product presentations for global mobile operators in Europe and received a lot of positive feedback. We are now drafting cooperation agreements with some of these companies.  This leads us to introduce the following changes:  1. We move the start of the ICO to 20 April 2018. By this time we will finalize the new strategic partnerships with large telecoms and will start joint pilot implementation of BubbleTone’s blockchain-based platform.  Firstly, this will secure an independent in-depth assessment and provide recognition from the leading industry players.  Secondly, this will help to protect the project participants from the bearish sentiment that is currently prevalent in the cryptocurrencies market.  2. The hard cap is lowered to 25 million US dollars. We estimate this amount to be sufficient, as the advancement of the platform and the development of the mobile application get ahead of the original schedule.  This will ensure that by the time the ICO starts, the product will have gained additional value for all participants.  Meanwhile, we emphasize that we do not shift the ending date of the ICO.  Therefore, the main target remains firmly in place. We hope to achieve it together!  Get ready: register, pass the KYC and join our Whitelist.

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: UMT is a utility token, used as fuel for smart contracts in BubbleTone system similar to GAS in Ethereum blockchain, in other words it is necessary to pay processing commissions to miners in BubbleTone system. UMT will be traded in exchanges same as any other token.      BubbleTone users won't need to have UMT to use BubbleTone services, but UMT token holders will be able to use UMT to pay for services in the application or sell UMT tokens.     Service providers and mobile operators will use UMT to pay commissions to miners for smart contracts processing. They will also be able to sell their tokens if needed.     Miners in our system can place 1 million or 1 thousand of UMT on their deposit and get a license for a Super or Mini Node, which generates revenue from smart contracts processing during the process of interaction between mobile operators, service providers and users within BubbleTone system. Miners will receive their income in UMT tokens and will be able to use them at their discretion.

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: We implement Proof of Importance (POI). Proof of importance is a way of how the system ensures all computers in the network form a consensus.  Every account on a blockchain network is assigned an importance score.  This score will influence how individual users can “harvest” the blockchain. One could say harvesting on blockchain is almost the same as what miners do on the Bitcoin blockchain. The objective is to add people’s transactions to the blockchain, in exchange for a small financial reward. As people’s importance score grows higher, they will have a better chance at getting these rewards.  All the transactions are public domain. Proof of importance also provides onlookers a way to determine rating for the importance of individual accounts on the network and ensures the network remains decentralized at all times.

Author: sir-watcher
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: How is your business model different from the one with roaming that we are used to?

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: In our model the procedure look the following: When a SIM card is first sold, the home operator validates the client and sends encrypted digital proof of the client’s validity into a blockchain. As a result, when the client goes to another country, there’s no need to provide their ID to get another SIM card. Roaming operators will only need to promptly offer their services and price quotes, and the network will distribute this information and use it to bill clients itself. The offers will be regulated by the law of supply and demand, so technical and market share dominance will become less important than, for instance, the quality of service. Isn't this the cellular communication we always wanted? We are making communication services exponentially more affordable and are fighting inequality. The cost to use and support our system is significantly less than what you'll find with other operators today. Our system has many technological advantages (and some shortcomings, of course). For more information simply ask us any questions you may have.

Author: BubbleTone_Support
Title: [ANN][ICO] Bubbletone Blockchain in Telecom
Body: Initially we’re creating a community of small and medium-sized mobile operators that are looking for new services for their subscribers, such as global mobile coverage and value-added services, as well as new revenue streams on inbound tourists, Identity-as-a-Service and Voice-over-IP calls. While our blockchain platform is still under development, we have already received several requests from existing business projects to transfer their business processes to our blockchain. We are negotiating with Orange and Vodafone and signed with LinguaLeo (English learning service) and 10+ mobile operators (Tesco Mobile (IE), Citic Telecom (HK), TruRoam Asia (AU) etc.) with 20+M subscribers who are totally ready for Proof of Concept (PoC) of the BubbleTone Blockchain in Telecom solution. They need stable token and a quick blockchain platform, and, like ourselves, they got tired of the many intermediaries that sometimes earn more than those who actually provide services and conduct business. Our project kills roaming just for a starter.

There is no way to use one same applet with all SIM manufacturers and customization of the applet with every SIM manufacturer is a cost too. That is one of examples what the funds raised during the ICO will be spent for.
